head.title: Aging in America: The Path Ahead

hedline.hl1: Aging in America: The Path Ahead

abstract.p: Beth Holden letter on Peter G Peterson's Sept 18 Op-Ed

block.p: Peter G. Peterson says (Op-Ed, Sept. 18) that when it comes to Social Security, there are gradual and humane proposals available for saving money, like increasing the eligibility age for full benefits. This proposal ignores a basic fact.

Peter G. Peterson says (Op-Ed, Sept. 18) that when it comes to Social Security, there are gradual and humane proposals available for saving money, like increasing the eligibility age for full benefits. This proposal ignores a basic fact.

With each year of (older) life, the body moves more slowly, and the ability to endure the stresses of the working day is diminished. Certainly, some outstanding people in their 70's and 80's have accomplished what many younger people might envy. But to require a person over 65 to continue to meet workplace demands before receiving the money that he or she has paid into the system is hardly humane.
